SEARCH
Package edu.rpi.legup.history

Interface ICommand

All Known Implementing Classes:
AddTreeElementCommand, ApplyDefaultDirectRuleCommand, AutoCaseRuleCommand, ClueCommand, DeleteTreeElementCommand, EditDataCommand, EditLineCommand, EditLineCommand, MergeCommand, PuzzleCommand, ValidateCaseRuleCommand, ValidateContradictionRuleCommand, ValidateDirectRuleCommand
public interface ICommand
The ICommand interface defines the structure for command objects in a command pattern. It provides methods to execute, undo, redo commands, and to check if a command can be executed.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    canExecute()
    Determines whether this command can be executed
    void
    execute()
    Executes the command.
    String
    getError()
    Gets the reason why the command cannot be executed
    void
    redo()
    Redoes the command.
    void
    undo()
    Undoes the command.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      void execute()
      Executes the command. The specific behavior depends on the implementation

    • canExecute

      boolean canExecute()
      Determines whether this command can be executed
      Returns:
      true if can execute, false otherwise

    • getError

      String getError()
      Gets the reason why the command cannot be executed
      Returns:
      if command cannot be executed, returns reason for why the command cannot be executed, otherwise null if command can be executed

    • undo

      void undo()
      Undoes the command. Reverts the changes made by the execute method

    • redo

      void redo()
      Redoes the command. Re-applies the changes made by the execute method after undoing
